intro: Grewia meizophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed globemallow, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, often in rocky or sandy soils. Grewia meizophylla is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
